supporting_text: The intersectorial nature of AMR problem gives specific meaning to this Strategy, through integration of all relevant sectors.
Specific objectives include information and education of patients and community for the importance of prudent use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes activities related to the control of supply and use of antibiotics for animals.
The document does not specify distinct strategies targeting the environment.
The NAP includes monitoring of the use of antibiotics in animals and guidelines for veterinary medicine.
The document does not mention specific mechanisms for progress reporting.
The NAP does not specify time-bound targets for tracking progress.
The document does not provide quantitative targets for AMR prevalence or antimicrobial use.
The NAP does not specify budget allocations for the strategies.
The document does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
Intersectorial Commission for control of AMR shall be established by the Government of the Republic of Macedonia.
The document does not mention specific strategies for strengthening the legislative framework.
Promotion of education and training of health professionals on AMR problem is included.
Information and education of patients and community for the importance of prudent use of antibiotics is included.
The NAP mentions cooperation with international institutions for AMR data and research.
Strengthening the system for AMR surveillance and control is one of the specific objectives.
The document does not specify actions related to developing capacity for detecting newly emerged resistance.
The NAP includes measures for infection control and prevention.
The document does not mention specific international standards or guidelines for AMR control.
The document does not specify regulations for the distribution or prescription of antibiotics.
The document does not mention regulations requiring rational use of antibiotics.
The document does not specify participation in international collaborative research.
